intro: Dunalia brachyacantha, commonly known as the short-stalked dunalia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color and are arranged in spikes, attracting various pollinators. Dunalia brachyacantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
